content.description: Lysosomes digest food particles brought into a cell by endocytosis. After a vesicle containing food particles fuses with a lysosome, <math alttext="H plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions are transported into the lysosome from the cytosol. This significantly lowers the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> of the lysosome relative to the cytosol and activates the enzymes that digest the particles.
content.question: Which of the following best predicts what will happen to the lysosomal enzymes if the proteins that transport <math alttext="H plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions from the cytosol into the lysosome are damaged?

choices.label: The lysosomal enzymes will not become active, since there will be no active transport of <math alttext="H plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions.

The lysosomal enzymes will not become active, since <math alttext="H plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will diffuse out of the lysosome.

The lysosomal enzymes will become active, since facilitated diffusion will move <math alttext="H plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions into the lysosome.

The lysosomal enzymes will become active, since passive diffusion will move <math alttext="H plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions into the lysosome.

content.answer: The lysosomal enzymes will not become active, since there will be no active transport of <math alttext="H plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions.
